desert.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a large area of land where it is always very dry, there are few plants, and there is a lot of sand or rocks
desert.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: This area of the country is mostly desert.
The plane crash-landed in the desert.
desert.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a place where there is no activity or where nothing interesting happens
desert.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The railroad yard was a desert now.
desert.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: the vast Gobi desert in China
Outside the city there was nothing but empty desert.
Very little can grow in this arid desert.
The interior of the country is an inhospitable desert.
Years of intensive farming have turned the area into a barren desert.
A hot dry wind blows from the desert areas of North Africa.
the flat desert landscape outside Kuwait

desert.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them
desert.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Helen was deserted by her husband.
Many of the party’s traditional voters deserted it at the last election.
The price rise caused many readers to desert the magazine.
He deserted her for another woman.
desert.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to leave a place so that it is completely empty
desert.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The birds have deserted their nest.
desert.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to leave the army, navy etc without permission
desert.translation[1].definitions[3].def: if a feeling, quality, or skill deserts you, you no longer have it, especially at a time when you need it
desert.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: Mike’s confidence seemed to have deserted him.
